html: By speaking to the king’s representatives in the local dialect, Rabshakeh attempts to put fear into the hearts of the people. His reference to their eating their own dung and drinking their own urine alludes to Assyria’s plan to lay siege to the city if its occupants don’t surrender. Starving them out would present an easy victory. King Hezekiah, however, has his own plan of dealing with the alien threat. He knows that—according to the terms of the Davidic Covenant—so long as he keeps Jehovah’s law and the people keep Hezekiah’s law, Jehovah is bound by the terms of his covenant to protect them.
